documents.document: @GopAaron2 @EngelNaylor Spot on. We in the UK 'feel your pain'
@labour_hate @HouseOfTraitors I won't have been first time she's told him she's got a headache
@afneil Or worth Carney's inflated salary? Sadly we probably need him to maintain market stability
@castellanoslj @GuidoFawkes Something a tad circular about your argument. I'll leave you on the merry-go-round (together with my EU friends)
@castellanoslj @GuidoFawkes For some1 who was so adamant that our government was a bunch of clowns you seem remarkably wishy-washy. Off now
@castellanoslj @GuidoFawkes Poor old Guido will be bored of seeing this but I do accredit you each time. Re chippyâ€¦ https://t.co/OCgCGASzlD
@IainDale @KateHoeyMP Fantastic. In time to listen to when JO'B comes on
@mkultra1971 @LBC Open up that box of trolls. I want to be in it with the sensible, considered people, not listening to this jackass
@castellanoslj @GuidoFawkes What a chippy little chorizo you sound. With friends like that...
@TelePolitics Gosh, the new recipe for fiscal success - an SNP/Green deal. If anyone's better off I'd be amazed
@ChrisClandestin @wirespyuk He's so vile. He obviously wasn't wedgied enough at school. I can't listen to the oaf anymore.
@jamescousins Sorry, 'your' ðŸ˜”
@jamescousins Oh if you're work is voluntary and you don't take a salary crack on. While whistling Dixie for all I care
@jamescousins Wandsworth is a good council. But it has no stand to make on a democratically elected US President
@jamescousins When borough is so thoroughly-well run, when pedestrians and cyclists aren't being run down, when potholes aren't abundant...?
@BBCBusiness @BBCNews When will the BBC change the 'despite Brexit' line to a 'because of Brexit' one when reporting good financial news?
@USA1stAlways @LeighPatrick @redsteeze @DebraMessing To equate their actions w those of the French underground movement by name is sickening
@HackneyAbbott It seems that said speech has made you run for the hills. Trots again?
@USAinUKpress If your new President were able to put some pressure on Putin to ease things there that would be a real triumph
@Snigglewhip @LeighPatrick (Although I could never endorse voting for Obama or Clinton of course)
@Snigglewhip @LeighPatrick Borrowed from someone but it couldn't be put much better IMO https://t.co/akTQjSo3Ci
@jamescousins It is important if you have nothing better to do. Like other councils that pontificate on this you'll be a laughing stock IMO
@matspks @HerbieHarrow @HackneyAbbott It certainly looks like cowardice. Not close enough thank goodness to know if smells like cowardice
@David_A_Dupont @tinabobuk Damn bloody right. This lurch toward hooliganism masquerading as democracy is disgusting and must be fought.
@campbellclaret The claret to remind us of the bloodshed caused by your lies? Horrid.
@Becca40458524 @EUVoteLeave23rd I'm inclined to believe you but seen from UK perspective Dems to have behaved so badly it's conceivable
@DickDelingpole As soon as you've updated your credit card to read Major General Delingpole
@julianhoyles @tinabobuk My outlook for the EU isn't that rosy sadly. Someone has rubbished this as a source but I'â€¦ https://t.co/6j7XrsxO7h
@RubyMalvolio @qui_gon_stim @Andrew4Pendle I suspect we shan't agree so best wishes, fingers crossed and try and enjoy the ride?
@RubyMalvolio @qui_gon_stim @Andrew4Pendle I agree re free movement but not free trade. I've always viewed EU as highly protectionist. But
@RubyMalvolio @qui_gon_stim @Andrew4Pendle I read it as implying the EU is unsustainable. & w Ted Malloch (perhaps) in I'm inclined to agree
@RubyMalvolio @qui_gon_stim @Andrew4Pendle I found this illuminating. I certainly don't relish the EU having a hardâ€¦ https://t.co/fgd9CtGqtC
@RealBlackIrish @tinabobuk I feel I took a bullet for the team there. I had to download the revolting thing onto my phone.
@RealBlackIrish @tinabobuk @RhonddaBryant Well, at least he's a highly respected MP, scrupulous with expenses and gâ€¦ https://t.co/0NhIDoAtfp
@ThePoke @SebDance @Nigel_Farage It adds weight to generally held belief that this Parliament is little more than a children's playground.
@MrSteerpike @afneil Haven't refugees suffered enough? Sitting round the breakfast table with her & Balls they'd be on the first train out.
@NottmsteveH @BBCPolitics I'm interested to know what the lies were said in that clip. Please enlighten me as I'm (perpetually) baffled
@Anorakian Read your bio thing and agree wholeheartedly. Racist!
@Anorakian @mubdymubbs It's extraordinary. I used to see myself as being pretty mild & tolerant but feel I can't be with my 'fascist' views
@RT_com I really want to know how much this man is giving to 'the Resistance'. It's very name is a fucking insult
@iainjwatson @ParlyApp Too little...too little
@MagnaCartaRules @Engrugger @timfarron You think I'd trust that man with my coat?
@SurferObserver @RoundLike You just need to read this excellent article by @GuidoFawkes https://t.co/qomQ6sX7uc
@LeaveEUOfficial "The muggers who are mugging you won't like it that you're running away." Who gives a fuck?
@CostlyWrath @LeaveEUOfficial Couldn't face watching but read the blurb. Nothing new whatsoever and made me no less happy than I am now.
@Saudi_Feminist_ @AMDWaters Damn it. Wish they'd told me earlier as I'm busy celebrating #worldlavatorypaperday
@BDStanley @JuliaHB1 Fantastic. It'll be a sell-out
@SebGorka Great interview. Summed up the position beautifully #newsnight
@JoanHenry7 @LBC Milan? I used to like Nick Abbott pre 23/6 & have given up both him & of course James OB. Darren Adams is getting there too
@lbc Can you report the fact that petition welcoming Trump is closing in on 100k mark? Not bad for an exercise in rationale over hysteria
@truemagic68 FE Smith mentioned in Algy Cluff's memoirs that I'm reading at the moment. A very jolly read.
@tinabobuk @timfarron He's been asked to serve the fish finger course
@Engrugger @lilyallen I suppose she lent weight to the adage that the good die young
@Engrugger @lilyallen May I remain where I feel I am? Somewhere between a mildly irritating vapid twerp and a withered (dead) Nazi.
@Telegraph "My instinct is no at the moment, not to support any amendments." Any more lukewarm and it'd be cold
@the_iain_club @mutablejoe @HarrietMaltby I'll leave you and your chip to it. Bonne chance x
@JoelTaylorhack @GuyVerhofstadt @geertwilderspvv (You know how thick we Leavers are)
@JoelTaylorhack @GuyVerhofstadt @geertwilderspvv I always get you two mixed up. I thought it'd be pretty brave for ole Wilders to be there!
@1markconway Not yet, but I think he's feeling the pressure from the forty amassed in Yeovil
@PaulWalmsley1 @BBCNewsnight I can almost smell the stench of scorched trainer
@BBCNewsnight @spectator Excellent. And it's excellence is shown by the detractors' comments to it. Good job
@mutablejoe @HarrietMaltby Ok. It's hard to tell these days
@mutablejoe @HarrietMaltby You don't see his election as equivalent to planning permission in your (rather tortured, if I may) analogy?
@MDSebach @clairefinn54 Live by the sword...
@WomensHistMonth @BuzzFeed Gosh. That poor child. Why is she allowed to play with such revolting and stereotypicalâ€¦ https://t.co/W1pxzOpsIY
@ChristianJMay @ajcdeane Sorry, missed the author out ðŸ˜”
@ChristianJMay An excellent read, with sentiments echoed (I'd have hoped) by any sane and rational human being. Manâ€¦ https://t.co/cFG5bfkp3G
Excellent point. A virtue signaller who can do something about it. Have you & if so what did he say @TulipSiddiq ? https://t.co/w3PaZBoEL2
@sunny_hundal That's terribly cruel given this poor woman's gait
@Cannamuse And rightly so, in my opinion
@Nick_Pettigrew Nice, but too close to the excellent line: 'He's an idiot savant, without the savant.' Is that one of yours @toadmeister?
@baxter815 @indiaknight Abso-bloody-lutely.
@baxter815 @indiaknight I wasn't offended by driver who nearly knocked my daughter down doing 50mph in 30 zone. But I did want him punished
@realDonaldTrump Good luck with it. The anti chatter coming from the UK is best summed up as 'the empty vessel making the most noise'
@indiaknight I hadn't realised these questions needed such extensive rumination as to require a holiday. A yes or no would have been enough
@ShireenQudosi @BBC In my opinion only a moron would argue against you. Absolutely spot on
@IainDale Like the day I switched off James O'Brien and muted him on Twitter. Like breathing clean air again
@indiaknight Would you find a joke about killing a UK MP acceptable in the present climate? From a journalist?
@Sargon_of_Akkad @LBC @mrjamesob He delights in being obtuse. As my dear grandmother would say 'He only does it because he knows it teases'
@DPJHodges @mjhsinclair @andrew_lilico @rupert_lescott @toadmeister @iainmartin1 Because he's head of state?
Keeping the neighbours awake with guffaws reading Algy Cluff's memoir "Get On With It" https://t.co/oZBZohe7e1
@LeighPatrick Their credibility must be shot to pieces, no? I suppose they know that by shouting loudest they can continue to lie ad nauseum
@toadmeister @spectator She usually is right. I wont read till I've seen it
@JoelTaylorhack She would I suspect be horrified to viewed as a victim. She's from a generation that understood what a real victim was
@Jamin2g I dread the day when Owen Jones is taken seriously. Then we'll really be doomed
@pokerpro23 @The_Evil_Barbie @realDonaldTrump @hopenothate It certainly smells of incitement
@KateMaltby My old man? A bit. But that's the vanity many of us men have to contend with. When are you back at the Spectator?
@KateMaltby LATEST - TRUMP WEARS SLIP-ONS. PHOBIA OF LACES SUSPECTED. Laces to be banned from US shops...
@KateMaltby My old man's about his age and a bit unsteady around stairs sometimes. This is getting truly pathetic.
@Itwitius There was a lot of info in this piece to be fair - https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@mubdymubbs @paulross No. There was always intended scope for this I think judging from this piece - https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@qasimakhtar89 @Independent If you've time do read this. Very illuminating & punctures quite a few 'misconceptions' https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@DouglasCarswell This was a good article and widely available https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@katebevan @sophiescott No, I think that there was always intended to be scope for this if this is anything to go by https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@DPJHodges And that we'll also read this so that we are informed and can make considered responses https://t.co/K8xoepTqMJ
@MsDanicaLee @YouTube & these people are..like..so...like..real and I'm like..so..sad so I said..Even the promise of tears couldn't hold me
@Sidjamesdad @HancockArchive @AmazonUK Gor that had me flummoxed. Of course though collecting the musicians from cereal packets. Brilliant
@Irishchutzpah @wirespyuk @thetimes @indiaknight Were I @rupertmurdoch I would be mortified
@nntaleb @rodrikdani What an crass thing to say Rodrik. You seem a bright fellow so it must be deliberate. Why say that if not to divide?
